Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கல்லாதான் ஒட்பம் கழியநன் றாயினும் கொள்ளார் அறிவுடை யார்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Although the natural knowledge of an unlearned man may be very good, the wise will not accept for true knowledge.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: An unlearned but naturally clever person ('கல்லாதான்') offers a rough, uncut diamond ('ஒட்பம்') to a group of wise gemologists ('அறிவுடையார்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The gemologists examine the diamond. While acknowledging its raw potential, they gently refuse it, pointing instead to a perfectly cut, multi-faceted, and brilliantly shining diamond on a nearby pedestal, which represents true, refined knowledge.
Layered_Composition.Background: A workshop filled with tools for cutting and polishing gems, symbolizing the process of formal learning and refinement that turns raw intelligence into true wisdom.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The wise do not accept raw, unrefined intelligence as true knowledge, even if it has some inherent value. True knowledge requires the structure and refinement of learning.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The uncut diamond is raw, natural intelligence. The perfectly cut diamond is refined, structured knowledge. The gemologists represent the truly wise, who can tell the difference.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Discerning, wise, intellectual, a subtle rejection.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The scene is lit by the brilliant, scintillating light from the cut diamond. The uncut diamond has only a dull, internal gleam. The palette is clean and precise.

Technical_Cues.Camera: Medium shot focusing on the interaction between the person offering the uncut gem and the wise ones who are refusing it.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with detailed macro shots of the diamonds.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Complex lighting with caustics from the cut diamond, emphasizing its perfection.

Cultural_Anchors: The discerning nature of the truly wise ('அறிவுடையார்')
